Unified PLS fit with auto backend

Source: R/pls_fit.R
pls_fit.Rd

Dispatches to a dense (Arm/BLAS) backend for in-memory matrices or to a streaming big.matrix backend when X (or Y) is a big.matrix.

Usage

pls_fit(
  X,
  y,
  ncomp,
  tol = 1e-08,
  backend = c("auto", "arma", "bigmem"),
  scores = c("none", "r", "big"),
  chunk_size = 10000L,
  scores_name = "scores",
  mode = c("auto", "pls1", "pls2"),
  scores_target = c("auto", "new", "existing"),
  scores_bm = NULL,
  scores_backingfile = NULL,
  scores_backingpath = NULL,
  scores_descriptorfile = NULL,
  scores_colnames = NULL,
  return_scores_descriptor = FALSE
)

Arguments

X

numeric matrix or bigmemory::big.matrix

y

numeric vector or single-column big.matrix

ncomp

number of latent components

tol

numeric tolerance used in the core solver

backend

one of "auto", "arma", "bigmem"

scores

one of "none", "r", "big"

chunk_size

chunk size for the bigmem backend

scores_name

name for the scores big.matrix (when scores="big")

Value

a list with coefficients, intercept, weights, loadings, means, and optionally $scores.

Examples
